snippet: Leo E. Strine Jr., the chief chancellor of Delaware Court Chancery, says he will decide whether to block El Paso's $21.1 billion sale to Kinder Morgan by March 6, the date of a shareholder vote.
abstract: Leo E. Strine Jr., the chief chancellor of Delaware Court Chancery, says he will decide whether to block El Paso's $21.1 billion sale to Kinder Morgan by March 6, the date of a shareholder vote.

byline.original: By MICHAEL J. DE LA MERCED

headline.main: Judge to Weigh Halting El Paso Sale to Kinder Morgan
